issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: The Facebook iOS SDK 4.27.0 improves the support for Xcode 9 and iOS 11, so we should adopt it as well.

comments.body:
PR (ti.facebook/master): https://github.com/appcelerator-modules/ti.facebook/pull/87
PR (ti/master): https://github.com/appcelerator/titanium_mobile/pull/9486
PR (ti/6_3_X): https://github.com/appcelerator/titanium_mobile/pull/9487

Test-Case: Simply run the usual Facebook smoke-tests. If the build succeeds and the existing API's are working as before, we are good to go. 

OT // I may start writing unit-tests inside Xcode for this as well, so it could be hooked into the build-pipeline. If it works out, we could do the same for the core, to have more core-close tests compared to the mocha-tests as well.
I ran the demo Facebook app from the docs using the version and app build without any issues.
